poem:
Title: "In the Shadow of Knowledge"

The keystone of knowledge quivers
in raucous discord, wedged between 
rival chants. Sharp sticks echo louder than words,
carving channels of conflict into hallowed grounds.
Upturned earth weeps for peace extinguished,
trampled underfoot by the march of mayhem.
Barricade of hope splintered, a pyre's spark ascends,
illuminating the irony - learning drowned
in the cacophony of unheard cries.
